verses.verse: Judge<WG2919> not, that you be not judged. <WG2919>
For with what<WG3739> judgment<WG2917> you judge,<WG2919> you shall be judged:<WG2919> and with what<WG3739> measure<WG3358> you mete,<WG3354> it shall be measured<WG488> to you again. <WG488>
And why<WG5101> behold<WG991> you the mote<WG2595> that is in your brother's<WG80> eye,<WG3788> but consider<WG2657> not the beam<WG1385> that is in your<WG4674> own eye? <WG3788>

Or<WG2228> how<WG4459> will you say<WG2046> to your brother,<WG80> Let<WG863> me pull<WG1544> out the mote<WG2595> out of your<WG4675> eye;<WG3788> and, behold,<WG2400> a beam <WG1385> is in your<WG4675> own eye? <WG3788>

You hypocrite,<WG5273> first<WG4412> cast<WG1544> out the beam<WG1385> out of your<WG4675> own eye;<WG3788> and then<WG5119> shall you see<WG1227> clearly<WG1227> to cast<WG1544> out the mote<WG2595> out of your brother's<WG80> eye. <WG3788>

Give<WG1325> not that which<WG3588> is holy<WG40> to the dogs,<WG2965> neither<WG3366> cast<WG906> you your<WG5216> pearls<WG3135> before<WG1715> swine,<WG5519> lest<WG3379> they trample<WG2662> them under<WG1722> their feet,<WG4228> and turn<WG4762> again<WG4762> and rend<WG4486> you.
Ask,<WG154> and it shall be given<WG1325> you; seek,<WG2212> and you shall find;<WG2147> knock,<WG2925> and it shall be opened<WG455> to you:
For every<WG3956> one that asks<WG154> receives;<WG2983> and he that seeks<WG2212> finds;<WG2147> and to him that knocks<WG2925> it shall be opened. <WG455>
Or<WG2228> what<WG5101> man<WG444> is there of you, whom<WG3739> if<WG1437> his son<WG5207> ask<WG154> bread,<WG740> will he give<WG1929> him a stone? <WG3037>
Or<WG2532> if<WG1437> he ask<WG154> a fish,<WG2486> will he give<WG1929> him a serpent? <WG3789>

If<WG1487> you then,<WG3767> being<WG5607> evil,<WG4190> know<WG1492> how to give<WG1325> good<WG18> gifts<WG1435> to your<WG5216> children,<WG5043> how<WG4214> much<WG4214> more<WG3123> shall your<WG5216> Father<WG3962> which<WG3588> is in heaven<WG3772> give<WG1325> good<WG18> things to them that ask<WG154> him?

Therefore<WG3767> all<WG3956> things whatever <WG3745> <WG302> you would<WG2309> that men<WG444> should do<WG4160> to you, do<WG4160> you even<WG2532> so<WG3779> to them: for this<WG3778> is the law<WG3551> and the prophets. <WG4396>

Enter<WG1525> you in at<WG1223> the strait<WG4728> gate:<WG4439> for wide <WG4116> is the gate,<WG4439> and broad <WG2149> is the way,<WG3598> that leads<WG520> to destruction,<WG684> and many<WG4183> there be which<WG3588> go<WG1525> in thereat: <WG1223>
Because<WG3754> strait <WG4728> is the gate,<WG4439> and narrow <WG2346> is the way,<WG3598> which<WG3588> leads<WG520> to life,<WG2222> and few<WG3641> there be that find<WG2147> it.
Beware<WG4337> of false<WG5578> prophets,<WG5578> which<WG3748> come<WG2064> to you in sheep's<WG4263> clothing,<WG1742> but inwardly<WG2081> they are ravening<WG727> wolves. <WG3074>
You shall know<WG1921> them by their fruits.<WG2590> Do men gather<WG4816> grapes<WG4718> of thorns,<WG173> or<WG2228> figs<WG4810> of thistles? <WG5146>

Even so<WG3779> every<WG3956> good<WG18> tree<WG1186> brings<WG4160> forth<WG4160> good<WG2570> fruit;<WG2590> but a corrupt<WG4550> tree<WG1186> brings<WG4160> forth<WG4160> evil<WG4190> fruit. <WG2590>

A good<WG18> tree<WG1186> cannot <WG3756> <WG1410> bring<WG4160> forth<WG4160> evil<WG4190> fruit,<WG2590> neither <WG3761> can a corrupt<WG4550> tree<WG1186> bring<WG4160> forth<WG4160> good<WG2570> fruit. <WG2590>
Every<WG3956> tree<WG1186> that brings<WG4160> not forth<WG4160> good<WG2570> fruit<WG2590> is hewn<WG1581> down,<WG1581> and cast<WG906> into<WG1519> the fire. <WG4442>
Why <WG686> <WG1065> by their fruits<WG2590> you shall know<WG1921> them.

Not every<WG3956> one that said<WG3004> to me, Lord,<WG2962> Lord,<WG2962> shall enter<WG1525> into<WG1519> the kingdom<WG932> of heaven;<WG3772> but he that does<WG4160> the will<WG2307> of my Father<WG3962> which<WG3588> is in heaven. <WG3772>

Many<WG4183> will say<WG2046> to me in that day,<WG2250> Lord,<WG2962> Lord,<WG2962> have we not prophesied<WG4395> in your name?<WG3686> and in your name<WG3686> have cast<WG1544> out devils?<WG1140> and in your name<WG3686> done<WG4160> many<WG4183> wonderful<WG1411> works?
And then<WG5119> will I profess<WG3670> to them, I never<WG3763> knew<WG1097> you: depart<WG672> from me, you that work<WG2038> iniquity. <WG458>

Therefore<WG3767> whoever <WG3956> <WG3748> hears<WG191> these<WG5128> sayings<WG3056> of mine,<WG3450> and does<WG4160> them, I will liken<WG3666> him to a wise<WG5429> man,<WG435> which<WG3748> built<WG3618> his house<WG3614> on a rock: <WG4073>

And the rain<WG1028> descended,<WG2597> and the floods<WG4215> came,<WG2064> and the winds<WG417> blew,<WG4154> and beat<WG4363> on that house;<WG3614> and it fell<WG4098> not: for it was founded<WG2311> on a rock. <WG4073>

And every<WG3956> one that hears<WG191> these<WG5128> sayings<WG3056> of mine,<WG3450> and does<WG4160> them not, shall be likened<WG3666> to a foolish<WG3474> man,<WG435> which<WG3748> built<WG3618> his house<WG3614> on the sand: <WG285>

And the rain<WG1028> descended,<WG2597> and the floods<WG4215> came,<WG2064> and the winds<WG417> blew,<WG4154> and beat<WG4350> on that house;<WG3614> and it fell:<WG4098> and great<WG3173> was the fall<WG4431> of it.
And it came<WG1096> to pass, when<WG3753> Jesus<WG2424> had ended<WG4931> these<WG5128> sayings,<WG3056> the people<WG3793> were astonished<WG1605> at<WG1909> his doctrine:<WG1322>
For he taught<WG2258> <WG1321> them as one having<WG2192> authority,<WG1849> and not as the scribes.<WG1122>
